item.title: Are local taxes established as deductions?
item.description:
It’s common for local taxes like earnings or “head” taxes to be set up as deductions in payroll systems. These taxes often have income thresholds, like Denver’s “head” tax, which only affects individuals earning over $500 monthly. However, common payroll software may not calculate thresholds based on periods other than per pay period, year-to-date, or life-to-date. This limitation might force you to handle monthly thresholds differently. Using deductions for tracking local taxes offers flexibility but can cause issues during year-end processing...
